GPyOpt.methods package¶

Submodules¶

GPyOpt.methods.bayesian_optimization module¶

class GPyOpt.methods.bayesian_optimization.BayesianOptimization(f, bounds=None, kernel=None, X=None, Y=None, optimize_model=None, model_optimize_interval=1, model_optimize_restarts=5, acquisition='EI', acquisition_par=0.01, model_data_init=None, sparse=False, num_inducing=None, normalize=False, verbosity=0)[source]¶

Bases: GPyOpt.core.bo.BO

Bayesian Optimization using EI, MPI and LCB (or UCB) acquisition functions.

This is a thin wrapper around the methods.BO class, with a set of sensible defaults

Param:

f the function to optimize
Parameters:
  • bounds – Tuple containing the box constrains of the function to optimize. Example: for [0,1]x[0,1] insert [(0,1),(0,1)].
  • X – input observations
  • Y – output values
  • kernel – a GPy kernel, defaults to rbf + bias.
  • optimize_model – Unless specified otherwise the parameters of the model are updated after each iteration.
  • model_optimize_interval – number of iterations after which the parameters of the model are optimized.
  • model_optimize_restarts – number of initial points for the GP parameters optimization (5, default)
  • acquisition – acquisition function (‘EI’ ‘MPI’ or LCB). Default, EI.
  • acquisition_par – parameter of the acquisition function.
  • model_data_init – number of initial random evaluations of f is X and Y are not provided (default, 3*input_dim).
  • sparse – whether to use an sparse GP (False, default).
  • num_inducing – number of inducing points for a Sparse GP (None, default)
  • normalize – whether to normalize the Y’s for optimization (False, default).
  • verbosity – whether to show (1) or not (0, default) the value of the log-likelihood of the model for the optimized parameters.
